guide.title: GDP Status Report
guide.abstract: Status report of the GDP project

body.p: This is the status of the Gentoo Documentation Project. It will be posted regularly, but not with a static frequency. All questions can be posted to gentoo-doc@gentoo.org or to me personally.
The Gentoo Documentation Project, from now on abbreviated to GDP, has its own project page (just like almost all other Gentoo projects). You can find it at http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/gdp.
This status mail will briefly discuss the following tasks, objectives and/or projects related to the GDP:

li.uri: Status Updates on a per-developer basis

body.p: Sven Vermeulen has posted a preliminary TODO list that - amongst the pile of bugreports - need to be resolved. A tad later this TODO list is added to the GDP Website as a separate resource.
Developers interested in taking on a challenge posed by the TODO list can always inform the gentoo-doc mailinglist.

chapter.title: Status Updates on a per-developer basis

body.p: From now on, all GDP Developers are required to post a monthly status update on their own personal achievements. Such a status update, which must be mailed to gentoo-doc, contains at least:

ul.li: what the developer did the last month
what the developer is planning on doing the upcoming month(s)
what issues the developer had that he couldn't resolve

body.p: The following documentation has been updated to a great extend:

ul.li: Gentoo Kernel Guide with a rundown on the current kernel ebuilds
XML Guide with a chapter on the Gentoo Handbook format
Common Gentoo Ebuild Mistakes is now officially available as documentation. It is of course a direct rip-off of liquidx' document, but now we can safely link to it from other resources
Metadata.xml documentation is also officially available now. It is a copy/paste of the information found on the metastructure project
We now have an official Genkernel Guide thanks to Tim Yamin.

body.p: Sven Vermeulen has launched a proposal to provide DRPs to the Gentoo community. The proposal is in the first stage and will not be persued before the other documentation issues are finished.
More information can be found on Sven's Dev-page.
The Gentoo Installation Instructions have been altered to deal with the upcoming 2004.0 release. Changes include:

ul.li: Moving GRP-specific instructions to the end of the installation procedure for the x86 and ppc architectures
Update on the LiveCD structure as no more packages will be provided by the first LiveCD of the 2-CD LiveCD set in case of x86 and ppc
Updates on the Installing the Gentoo Installation Files

body.p: The Documentation Index has been updated to point to the relevant Gentoo Handbook chapters (for USE flags, Portage stuff, Environment Variables and Initscripts).
The links to the old gentoo-*-install.xml guides have been removed as those installation instructions are obsoleted.
